q: Do I need a ticket for SoNo Fest?
a: The street festival is free to enter, but chili tasting requires a paid pass.

q: How many tastings come with a pass?
a: Each tasting pass includes five generous samples from our competing restaurants.

q: Where and when do I pick up my bowl or mug?
a: Pre-event pickup runs Friday and Saturday at McKinley Elementary and San Diego Ceramic Connection. A limited number of bowls are available onsite Sunday while supplies last.

q: What kind of music will be on the stages?
a: We showcase San Diego bands across two stages with set times announced each fall.

q: Can I bring kids and strollers?
a: Absolutely.  Stroller parking is available near the Kids Zone.

q: What's pouring in the booze garden?
a: Expect local beer, wine, and cocktail partners. IDs are checked at the entrance; only guests 21+ may enter.
For everyoneâ€™s safety we welcome service animals only. Please leave pets at home.

q: What are my parking or transit options?
a: We recommend biking, walking, or rideshare. Limited street parking is available; plan your route at sdmts.com.

q: Is the event rain or shine?
a: Yes. SoNo Fest happens rain or shine, so dress for the weather.
Bring your commemorative mug back each year, use our refill stations, and compost at the clearly marked bins throughout the fest.
